item.title: Continuous Probability Distribution
item.description: If a random variable is continuous, its probability distribution is called a continuous probability distribution. Recap P(X = x) is zero if our X is continuous Continuous probability distributions cannot be tabulated It’s conceptually impossible: we would need to have an infinite number of rows and columns to account for every single P between 0-1, which is infinite. This is well demonstrated in the * Zeno’s Paradox *.

item.title: Discrete Probability Distribution
item.description: Probability distributions demonstrate the probability of an event. When dealing with discrete data, probability mass function of the event can come from various distributions. The most important discrete probability distributions are the Bernoulli, Binomial and Poisson.
